text:
Hello: It was taking roughly 6 minutes for fop to process a FO file for me. This
appears to be due to HTTP timeouts: we're firewalled on port 80 outbound here
and must use a web proxy.

I couldn't find any mention of web proxies in the FOP documentation in the
tarball nor the online FAQ. I did however find a mention of how to tell Java
your proxy details. It would be nice if this was relayed through the fop DOCS,
FAQ, or if the fop shellscript honoured the "http_proxy" environment variable.
creator: jon@alcopop.org

text:
Created attachment 18166
honours http_proxy env variable if found

Attached is a patch for fop.sh which, if the environment variable "http_proxy"
is defined, will pass the relevant arguments along to the java invocation. This
may need adjusting to be suitable for all operating environments: it was just
the minimum needed to get it working in my situation (Linux)
creator: jon@alcopop.org
manuel@apache.org
text:
Thanks for the patch but fop 0.20.5 is not longer being actively maintained and 
no further patches will be applied. Also these kind of customizations are 
usually done through user or site config files. In 0.20.5, if I am not 
mistaken, the fop.sh script looks for a .foprc file in your home directory. 
That's where I would think such settings would go.

creator: jon@alcopop.org

mechanism as provided in the current 0.92 shell script is an unsatisfactory 
solution to your problem.
